website_summaries.verdict: The AF-S Nikkor 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED is a light lens that covers a wide-angle field of view and offers a modest zoom, but it's not the best that Nikon has to offer.

customer_reviews.title: Happy enough.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this lens a lot for events with ocf and landscapes. It can be very sharp f8+ 18mm on a full frame is plenty wide enough for most situations and everybody loves 35mm It’s very light weight and does feel a bit cheap but I’ve had it 4years with no issues. No vr but tbh it’s either going to have a high shutter speed or be sat on a tripod. I’ve made my money back on this lens but there’s no much resale value on these so consider a used one before going full price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Zissou

customer_reviews.title: This lens is fantastic, crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: This lens is fantastic, crystal clear, I went out yesterday to try it out and every photo was tack sharp, after reading lots of reviews praising this lens I decided to bite the bullet and add it to my Nikon 24-120 and my Tamron 150-600 to give me a good range of lens and I'm glad I did, colours and contrast are excellent and the ED glass helps with Flare which there is none of in my photos. Do your self a favour and forget about the 16-35 VR and the 14-24 as this lens is perfect for an amateur like me, see examples of this lens on my D750
customer_reviews.author: T. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Superb lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens. Substantial solid build quality, amazing optics and great picture quality. Can't go wrong at whatever focal length, better than some prime lenses.
customer_reviews.author: mr m thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens, lightweight but that doesn't mean it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, lightweight but that doesn't mean it's not high quality. Image sharpness is good across the zoom range with the expected corner softness at the extremes but overall I'm very impressed with this lens for my D750.
customer_reviews.author: S. Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use it for landscapes and so far it is flawless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little hidden gem
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are prepared to spend the best part of £2k on a lens, this will be your best bet for a D800/E/810 travel kit, IMHO. I really can't fault this lens.The combination of sharpness, colour and weight makes it a bargain at the price.
customer_reviews.author: snapparazzi

customer_reviews.title: Useful and a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Use it all the time. With profile corrections in Lightroom, it works wonders. Cheap and cheerful
customer_reviews.author: Vassilios Maramenides

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens For The D600
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think the other reviews sum up what I would say. It's a excellent lens, I've had it a while now and I can't really fault it. I think its the best option for my D600, the cost is also a plus point.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Groves

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, and light enough to regularly take out ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, and light enough to regularly take out and use - as opposed to a super-fast, heavy and bulky lens that's always left at home.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Watson

customer_reviews.title: great to use very good definition I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: great to use very good definition I love this lens, a bit of a plastic finish but don't be put off the performance is simply excellent
customer_reviews.author: blackyam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my lenses. Really clear images and no problems. Well worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: ArtGirl

customer_reviews.title: I know my sharpness happy snapping.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp - Did I mention this lens is sharp ? I know my sharpness happy snapping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... capable for landscape photography when stopped down (to my favourite f7. 1 on D800) - results better than ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light and capable for landscape photography when stopped down (to my favourite f7.1 on D800) - results better than old 20mm D prime lens which has gone to live on my Sony A7r...
customer_reviews.author: SMary

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Lens
customer_reviews.text: a nice quality wide angle lens, is light in construction which makes it a good travel FS kit extra.
customer_reviews.author: Clive Dryden

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant lens as you would expect from Nikon. Produces excellent images.
customer_reviews.author: Nettieofnine

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. It's light, accurate and worth every penny. Arrived quickly too, which is always a bonus when eagerly awaiting new toys!
customer_reviews.author: Kazzizhubby

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens, really good quality. Gives you perfect angle for landscape photography!
customer_reviews.author: Klaudia

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, light and wide angle
customer_reviews.text: Initially i do not knew if i will buy this lens or 16-35, and i opted by this due to its lower price and size. I am very happy with its performance, sharpnes and light weight. Very good to use with circular filters because do not causes vigneting in the corners. The only issue is the distortion but the distortion correction in post processing can help here. So i am very happy with this lens, and i recomend for those who cant buy 16-35 and want a lightweight lens.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens for the price. Not as high quality as the top range Nikon stuff but a good quality wide lens for FX sensors. Light and reasonably compact compared to the bigger, heavier, more expensive but more premium Nikon16-35 f4. If you want the extra 2mm you'll have to pay more and go for that one but the 18-35 is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jonnyfez

customer_reviews.title: Tack sharp, light - a great upgrade over the older AF IF ED.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a lover of the late 90's version of this lens from the very outset. Well made with great optics. So why upgrade to this latest model? To be fair, the earlier model just lacked real edge to edge sharpness on the D800 but was passable on the D3x. I wanted a lens that was sharp, no matter what body I stuck it on. This does not disappoint. It is smooth in operation has no more distortion than it's predecessor and is so light in eight, it's a joy to carry. All in all a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: DRTphotos

customer_reviews.title: I love this little lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little lens! It would have got 5 stars, but the first one supplied was faulty. Amazon returns policy, however, meant that a replacement was with me the next day, easier than going to my local camera shop! The lens is small, light and plenty sharp enough for me. It's not one I will use as often as other lenses, therefore it was not worth spending the extra for the more professional Nikon wide angle zooms, but it is more than adequate for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Nuke

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this lens
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this lens. Returned all three copies due to severe de-centering problems, one at the wide end of the zoom, other two at the tele end. Poor Nikon QC.
customer_reviews.author: Gethin L.

customer_reviews.title: Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: Unfortuantely due to the weather I have only used this a few times so far this year but the pictures taken using this lens have looked good both on the screen and printed. Good size and weight so no problem carrying this around all day. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kbc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice up to 2014
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice zoom lens for its price, but anyone with a D750 and above, will feel neglected by Nikon in this category. The lens is just "not enough" for the top full frame models, by a small margin though. Had it been a little sharper at the edges it would have replaced most old Nikon primes in this focal length, for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Eleftherios Kritikakis

customer_reviews.title: This is a Good lens BUT . . .
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lens to supplement my wide angle photography but after using it for a week and evaluating this lens against the Nikon 16-35mm, I opted to purchase the 16-35 lens. The optics on this lens is good and produces excellent IQ, but I wanted the wider option and the 16-35 provided that . .
customer_reviews.author: Sam Adair

customer_reviews.title: best wide angle lens out there in market for NIKON at this price
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have this beautiful lens. This is fast, light weight, sharp and wide enough for my full frame D610. I initially tried couple of Non- NIKON cheaper options before buying this lens. But it was not really pleasing experience. There was a compromise on image quality and color casting issues etc. But I am really happy with this NIKKOR wide angle. At this price, this is the best lens out there in market for NIKON.
customer_reviews.author: Spendin_it_all_on_u

customer_reviews.title: Love my Nikon 18-35
customer_reviews.text: Love my Nikon 18-35. I took it with me to Paris and used it almost exclusively for all of my wide angle shots. The only time I changed it out was when I was shooting portraits in which case I used my 50. Great lens and the seller shipped quickly. Be aware that as with any ultra wide angle, there will be distortion around the edges at the widest (18).
customer_reviews.author: Angela Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens in quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens!! Just like the other reviews say, I am extremely pleased with the sharpness and overall image quality of my shots. There is a noticable improvement from my last Nikkor wide angle prime. I found my last lens had difficulty focusing on glass and semi-clear objects, but this lens picks up edges perfectly. Also, it is a few hundred less than similarly ranged lenses with the same output in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Do your research and you will end up with this lens. It's an amazing value compared to Nikon's other offerings. It's not quite as fast, but with ISOs on FX cameras, you don't need a 2.8 aperture. Likewise, you just loose depth of field at 2.8 compared to F4, which doesn't do you any favors in traditional wide angle photography. This lens has very little distortion. Make sure you buy a high quality filter for it!
customer_reviews.author: Mcdonald Mirabile

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for the price. It is as sharp as my lenses costing way more and I could not be happier. Fast Auto Focus and beautiful color with little flaring. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BRASELton

customer_reviews.title: "Sharp" is not everything
customer_reviews.text: Sharp alright, but no micro-contrast. Quickly develops noise. The images did not impress me. The 17-55mm produces better images. I returned mine and bit the bullet and purchased the 17-55. Now I have recovered from the price shock of the 17-55 and I feel much better knowing I have a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Chrichey

customer_reviews.title: A Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens for real estate photography; I would go 5 stars but from day 1 had a spot that appears in the upper left on any image with a light background. Was not worth returning, as I can easily remove it in post.I bought it used, so I'm not as picky as if I had purchased new. It's a great lens, I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T958

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED lens
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with the performance of this lens. It is everything that I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Magri Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, sharp lens. It’s worth the money, and it is light for carrying around. It would be nice if it was faster, but then the price and weight would go up, so cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Christianson

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a good bang for the buck landscape lens.
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens on a D750. My photography experience is very limited but I am enjoying myself. I use this lens for landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: Middle aged MenaceTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. After trying, and falling, to capture shots I wanted using the lens that came with my camera, this lens delivers. Great addition to my kit.
customer_reviews.author: BB & T

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used. Looks brand new. Took a few test shots the pictures look great. Just what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: CaffeinatedWithKids

customer_reviews.title: Great walk around lens
customer_reviews.text: I have this lens and the 16-35FX. This lens weighs much less than the 16-36FX and it is much more comfortable when your carry your camera for a long period I find I like this better. I do not find a tremendous amount of difference in the results.
customer_reviews.author: Fish Pictures

customer_reviews.title: Awesome daytime, landscape lens.
customer_reviews.text: For daytime landscapes, this is the lens. It's almost always on my camera. Check out [...] to see the results.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Price

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and wonderful resolution
customer_reviews.text: This lens is just terrific. I could not be happier with the results on my D800. Hated the lens cap, though. Went out and got a cap with the center grips.
customer_reviews.author: svcace

customer_reviews.title: similar to the great 20mm nikkor
customer_reviews.text: I have both 20mm prime and this 18 35,and to be honest, this 18 35 is almost on par on my d810. Small differences in color and contrast in favor of the 20mm but quite close. Great lens.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Mejía

customer_reviews.title: THE COMPANY IS A GOOD ONE
customer_reviews.text: WE RECEIVED EXCELLENT SERVICE AND THE ITEM WAS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED IT WORKS PERFECTLY.
customer_reviews.author: david martinez

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-35 a must have lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is so sharp, great color saturation, and its light. If you have a Fx Camera this lens is a must have. Look around and you won't see many of this lens for sale , because people hold on to very good lends.
customer_reviews.author: robert e leopard

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Lense purchase
customer_reviews.text: The lens came packed from Nikon factory and was secured properly. The lens itself was worth every penny...It's light, the optics are precise and I've had no issues during post-photo production in a wide range of pictures taken with this lens. For the price, compare to the 17-35mm, well worth the savings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens. Love this (inexpensive!) update to the old version.
customer_reviews.author: Myco

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens has surpassed my expectations in many ways. I was looking for a fairly affordable wide angle for a full frame camera, and stumbled upon this gem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lens looks great just have to try it now
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery! Lens looks great just have to try it now!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the very low price
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for the very low price. If you are a pro who make money taking pictures buy Nikon 14-24, otherwise this lens is good as it gets. For the price of Nikon 14-24, you can get this lens and Tamron 24-70 VC. Tamron just released 15-30 VC, if can spend little extra buy that, it competes with Nikon 14-24. This is a Great lens for under $800.
customer_reviews.author: Suhas Patel

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this lens
customer_reviews.text: The lens is well made, light weight and works perfectly. It's very sharp and focuses fairly quickly. I would recommend this lens for use on a full frame Nikon camera
customer_reviews.author: Sirraj

customer_reviews.title: outstanding lens for money
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Nikon camera owner since 1978. Purchase a D800e and am using first generation auto-focus lens which work well. I needed to add a wide angle lens in the 18 to 24mm range so I waited for this to be released. Its now my standard lens excellent sharpness and contrast. Its a great lens.
customer_reviews.author: keninfortmyers

customer_reviews.title: light, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Had this lens for a few years now. I c Airy it with me everywhere. It's light and wide enough. If I need wider, I stitch in photisgop. Sharpness is relatively poor in the corners.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Djokovic

customer_reviews.title: a great lens
customer_reviews.text: It's light and it has great image quality, that's all I need. Now it is my default lens, supplement it with a 50mm I can basically shoot any subject I encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Great daily wide-angle, sharper than most.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to the 20mm 1.8G because the 20mm was a bit more expensive and the reviews for the 18-35mm were great for landscape. After owning both, I would suggest still going for the 20mm 1.8G, a because its a 1.8 aperture and its a sharper lens and second it does amazing close shots. Now, the two don't really compare because one is a prime, other is a zoom but they are constantly put in competitions but for me the 20mm wins in sharpness and its a 1.8! Its a great lens for those who need a little stretch and won't go for a prime.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a great lens with my d750 but I feel that it is too expensive compared to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: luke

customer_reviews.title: Good lens. I like the range
customer_reviews.text: Good lens. I like the range. I knew it'd have some barrel distortion, and it does.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... use this for my job and it is very useful.
customer_reviews.text: i use this for my job and it is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes spending a little more in photography whether you're a hobbyist like myself or even a pro can make a difference. The clarity of pics taken with this lens are amazing, simple to use and learn, built sturdy. Taken 100s of pics so far and at times it is hard to take this one off the camera. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Millard

customer_reviews.title: clarity is great. the hood can be a problem
customer_reviews.text: clarity is great . the hood can be a problem ,it can go on crooked which show up in the photo
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight!
customer_reviews.text: I just got it and only did a little testing by, first and foremost, it comes across as a very light weight lens. I was expecting a heavier lens but, it is lighter than some smaller lenses I have. There are many other reviews here and plenty of tests done to this lens. When I shoot more images with it, I will add a bit more to the review and update.
customer_reviews.author: N. HylandTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Useless after two months
customer_reviews.text: Too bad. The specs for this lens are phenomenal for the price. But the focusing mechanism is flimsy, and refused to auto-focus after a few uses. No drops, no impacts, no nothing. Just took it out of its secure case one day and it failed to operate. Now I have to deal with Nikon to see how much it will cost to repair. I will follow up as soon as I find out.
customer_reviews.author: Beaulipp

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-35
customer_reviews.text: Always best to match the lens to the camera. A bit costly but imho worth the extra cost to match up a Nikon Camera with a Nikon Lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Blue

customer_reviews.title: Light, fast focus and sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is a gem of a lens! Light, fast and sharp! When driven by my D750 these three essential characteristics have produced some of the best quality shots I have ever taken. Very little distortion or edge softness at 18mm and it just gets better from 20mm onwards. I can't understand why some reviews I have read complain about the weight of this lens where 'lightness' is perceived as being less robust or more suited to amateur use. That's nonsense, think about a light or heavy object hitting something hard. Which might come off worse? Don't hesitate purchasing this lens, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: 2bhonest

customer_reviews.title: This is a gem of a lens, Very sharp ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a gem of a lens, Very sharp, If your comparing this to a crop sensor lens, then its just shy of 10mm. No distortion in the corners which I had with a Sigma. Couple of shots taken with this and a D610.
customer_reviews.author: Technodean

customer_reviews.title: This lens is a razor
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous lens. I was torn between this or paying £300 more for the 16-35. The lens - not the cost - was my main priority. I read lots of views, tried out another photographer's copy and took the plunge. It's stunning. Light weight and easily transportable and 18-35 suits me just fine for landscapes. At the photography show at the NEC I talked to several people on the Nikon stand who were full of praise for this optic. It's up there with any wideangle zoom Nikon has made. This article pretty much sums it up for me: [...] I
customer_reviews.author: Enigma Phil

customer_reviews.title: It is light and a good price but delivers like a much more expensive lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens and it stays on my camera. It is light and a good price but delivers like a much more expensive lens. I was worried obout the reviews I read but shouldn't have been top marks from me and I bought it second hand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens for landscape
customer_reviews.text: This lens fits you is you're the type of photographer that wants to have as much as possible in the picture, this lens has a 100 degree view witch makes it perfect for shooting. This can be used for close ups and moving objects (like a child) the focus is great and fast. I've had it now for over 2 months and it is superb!! The lens has a great feel when you hold it, it feels "expensive". If you want a all around lens this will be great! I am using this lens with the nikon d750.
customer_reviews.author: Ajdin Subasic

product_meta.title: Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED Zoom Lens with Auto Focus for Nikon DSLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


 A versatile, affordable wide-angle to standard view FX-format zoom lens.
Now you can cover the highly useful zoom range of 18mm to 35mm (27–52.5mm on DX-format cameras) with a great performing full-frame NIKKOR lens that doesn't carry a professional's price tag. Shoot beautiful wide-angle architectural shots, landscapes, group portraits and more; then zoom in for a natural field of view that is slightly wider than what we see with our eyes. You can even get as close as 0.92-feet from your subject! And since the AF-S NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED is powered by Nikon's Silent Wave Motor (SWM) for ultra-fast, ultra-quiet autofocusing, it's an ideal choice for video applications. 






USE IT EVERYWHERE
WIDE-ANGLE TO STANDARD ZOOM VERSATILITY
The AF-S NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED is an excellent travel and all-purpose lens. Its 18mm wide-angle perspective brings more of what you see into the frame, ideal for shooting indoors or in close quarters, capturing architecture and landscapes as well as group portraits. But zoom all the way in, and you get a natural 35mm perspective that mimics the field of view of our eyes, ideal for just about any photo or video application.

EXCELLENT FOR VIDEO
ULTRA-FAST, ULTRA-QUIET AUTOFOCUSING
The AF-S NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED is powered by Nikon's innovative Silent Wave Motor (SWM). This extraordinary focusing motor uses ultrasonic vibrations—rather than a gear system—to spin the lens barrel, resulting in nearly silent and ultra-fast autofocusing. If you want to override the AF system, simply take control of the focusing ring—M/A mode enables a seamless transition between auto and manual focusing.

A LIFETIME OF GREAT PERFORMANCE
NIKON LENS TECHNOLOGIES FOR CONSISTENTLY STUNNING IMAGES
Nikon's innovations in optical design and lens technology have paved the way for more affordable high-performance lenses like the AF-S NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED. Two Extra-low Dispersion (ED) elements produce superior sharpness and color correction, and three Aspherical Lens (AS) elements virtually eliminate certain types of aberration. A rounded 7-blade diaphragm produces softer, more natural backgrounds, and Internal Focusing (IF) keeps the lens compact and lightweight.
feature_bullets: Versatile FX-format wide-angle (18mm) to standard (35mm) zoom lens
Focal Length : 18-35 mm, Focus as close as 0.92 ft. from your subject
Excellent choice for travel and architecture, landscape and everyday photography as well as HD-Video applications
Nikon’s exclusive Silent Wave Motor (SWM) provides ultra-fast, ultra-quiet autofocusing with seamless manual override
Extra-low Dispersion (ED) and Aspherical (AS) glass elements ensure superior sharpness, color correction and other types of chromatic aberation.Maximum Angle of View (DX-format):76°

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars171 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
